With the mind of omniscience, they delight in benefiting and bringing happiness to all sentient beings, and they always protect all worlds. The treatise states:
This briefly clarifies the practice of loving-kindness that counteracts hatred.
The contemplation of dependent origination counteracts delusion. The meaning of dependent origination will now be explained.
In the Rice Sheaf Sutra it is said:
What are the internal dependent origination factors that are bound to causes?
Namely, ignorance conditions formations, up to birth conditions old age and death.
If there is no ignorance, then one knows there are no formations, up to if there is no birth, then one knows there is no old age and death.
Moreover, if ignorance truly ceases, then formations cease. In this way, up to if birth ceases, then old age and death cease.

Moreover, ignorance does not think 'I arise from formations,' and formations also do not think 'I arise from ignorance.' In this way, up to birth also does not think 'I arise from old age and death,' and old age and death also do not think 'I arise from birth.'
If ignorance truly arises, then formations arising would be unobtainable. In this way, up to birth arising, then aging and death arising would also be unobtainable.
One should know that this is the internal dependent arising of phenomena that is bound to causes.
Moreover, what are the internal dependent arising of phenomena that are bound to conditions?
It refers to the internal union of the elements of earth, water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness, which are bound to conditions.
What is the earth element?
It refers to that which causes this body to accumulate and transform, with solidity as its nature, called the earth element.
Moreover, if it causes the body to be absorbed and created, it is called the water element.
Moreover, if it causes the body's hot nature to manifest and digests food and drink, it is called the fire element.
Moreover, if it creates inhalation and exhalation in the body, it is called the wind element.
Moreover, if there are cavities in the body, it is called the space element.

It refers to this name-and-form, like two reeds supporting each other, causing the five consciousness bodies to be bound to the defiled mental consciousness, called the consciousness element.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
If these conditions are not present, the body does not transform.

If the internal earth element is not lacking, then the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements will also not be deficient, and the combination of them all will definitely cause the body to transform.

However, the earth element does not think, I can make the body a solid mass, the water element does not think, I can make the body cohesive and productive, the fire element does not think, I can make the body warm, digest food and drink, the wind element does not think, I can make exhalation and inhalation in the body, the space element does not think, I can form cavities and gaps in the body, and the consciousness element does not think, I am the condition that gives rise to the body. For this reason, the body is definitely able to transform.

Moreover, this earth element is without self, without person, without sentient being, without living being, without life, without human, neither male nor female, also neither non-male nor non-female, without mastery, without control, without this and without that, and without any substance. In the same way, the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are also without self, without person, without sentient being, without living being, without life, without human, neither male nor female, also neither non-male nor non-female, without mastery, without control, without this and without that, and without any substance.
Next, what is the meaning of ignorance?

It refers to giving rise to the notion of oneness, the notion of combination, the notion of solidity, the notion of permanence, bliss, self, and purity, the notion of sentient beings, living beings, life, humans, and boys, the notion of mastery, control, and so forth, within these six elements.
Such various kinds of non-knowledge are called ignorance.

Because of this ignorance, one thinks that there really are objects and gives rise to greed, ill-will, and delusion. Those objects of greed, ill-will, and delusion are called formations. The manifestation of these events is called consciousness.

When consciousness arises together, those four appropriated aggregates are called name-and-form. Moreover, the faculties that are the basis of this name-and-form are called the six sense bases. The union of the three factors is called contact. The experience of contact is called feeling. Because of attachment to feeling, it is called thirst. Because of the deepening and broadening of thirst, it is called grasping. Grasping is able to give rise to existence, and existence again gives rise to causes. Therefore, the arising of the aggregates is called birth, the ripening of the aggregates is called old age, and the cessation of the aggregates is called death. Ignorance, ill-will, and attachment that fear death are called grief. Regret and lamentation are called sorrow. The constant experience associated with the five consciousnesses is called suffering. The extreme suffering of mental activity and union is called distress.
